'''Ethics''' is a branch of [[philosophy]] which studies questions related to right and wrong, good and bad. Ethics is typically broken into at least five sub-disciplines, including <i>[[meta-ethics]]</i>, <i>[[value theory]]</i>, the <i>[[theory of conduct]]</i>, and <i>[[applied ethics]]</i>. Each of these will be defined below.
     
First, we need to define an "<i>[[ethical sentence]]</i>", also called a <i>normative statement</i>. An ethical sentence is one that is used to make either a positive or a negative (moral) evaluation of something. Ethical sentences typically use words such as "good," "bad," "right," "wrong," "moral," "immoral," and so on. Here are some examples:
